raw.title: Arm Compiler fromelf User Guide
raw.content_description: The image conversion utility, fromelf, enables you to process ARM ELF object and image files produced by the compiler, assembler, and linker, process all ELF files in an archive produced by armar, and output the processed files into another archive if required, convert ELF images into other formats that can be used by ROM tools or directly loaded into memory, protect Intellectual Property (IP) in images and objects that are delivered to third parties, and display information about the input file, for example, disassembly output or symbol listings, to either stdout or a text file.

raw.content_description: The image conversion utility, fromelf, enables you to process ARM ELF object and image files produced by the compiler, assembler, and linker, process all ELF files in an archive produced by armar, and output the processed files into another archive if required, convert ELF images into other formats that can be used by ROM tools or directly loaded into memory, protect Intellectual Property (IP) in images and objects that are delivered to third parties, and display information about the input file, for example, disassembly output or symbol listings, to either stdout or a text file.

raw.title: Arm Compiler armlink User Guide
raw.content_description: The linker, armlink, combines the contents of one or more object files with selected parts of one or more object libraries to produce an ARM ELF image, a partially linked ELF object that can be used as input in a subsequent link step, ELF files that can be demand-paged efficiently, and a shared object, compatible with the Base Platform Application Binary Interface (BPABI) or a BPABI executable file.

raw.title: Arm Compiler armlink User Guide
raw.content_description: The linker, armlink, combines the contents of one or more object files with selected parts of one or more object libraries to produce an ARM ELF image, a partially linked ELF object that can be used as input in a subsequent link step, ELF files that can be demand-paged efficiently, and a shared object, compatible with the Base Platform Application Binary Interface (BPABI) or a BPABI executable file.
